Cerita dari Desa Cantik yang Tersembunyi di Pedalaman Kalimantan
06 Nov 2019, 21:19 by Syanti Mustika


Desa Parupay yang cantik. (Syanti Mustika/detikcom)

Krayan - Pedalaman hutan Kalimantan memang penuh kejutan. Salah satunya datang dari desa ini, yang keindahannya sedemikian cantik rupawan walaupun lokasinya terpencil di tengah pedalaman hutan.Pemandangan hijau, langit bersih, udara yang segar dan sejuk. Paling tidak itulah tiga hal yang dapat dinikmati Krayan, Kalimantan Utara. Dijamin betah berlama-lama menikmati ketenangan alam di pedalaman Kalimantan ini.Beberapa waktu lalu tim Tapal Batas detikcom datang ke Krayan. Kami pun "secara tidak sengaja" datang ke sebuah desa bernama Desa Parupay.


Desa Parupay di Krayan. (Foto: Syanti Mustika/detikcom)

Dataran hijau membentang sangat luas. Kerbau-kerbau makan dengan lahap di lahan-lahan terbuka. Rumah-rumah berjajar rapi mengelilingi lapangan di sana. Dan desa itu dikelilingi oleh hijaunya perbukitan. Bisa dibilang ini adalah desa tersembunyi!Dalam kesempatan ini, detikcom pun bertemu dengan Pak Parir, Kepala Desa Parupay. Dia pun dengan ramah menjelaskan bahwa mereka sedang mempersiapkan destinasi wisata untuk para wisatawan."Kita punya destinasi wisata di alam sana yang kita buat dua tahun yang lalu. Dan ini telah dikunjungi oleh wisatawan dari Kalimantan Barat. Kita punya peninggalan sejarah, ada dua patung buaya, ada pondok batu, batu arit dan satu kuburan. Kita juga punya dua air terjun setinggi 50 meter dan semuanya ada di dalam hutan kita," ungkap Parir.


Foto: (Syanti Mustika/detikcom)

Namun sayang sekali, detikcom tidak berkesempatan mengunjungi tempat-tempat yang dimaksud karena lokasinya yang berada di dalam hutan dan butuh waktu tidak singkat demi bisa mengunjungi semua tempat.Desa Parupay sendiri memiliki 23 Kartu Keluarga dengan jumlah warga keseluruhan 89 orang. Dan mata pencarian utama dari desa ini adalah bertani. "Kita semua ada 89 orang termasuk anak kecil. Kita semua di sini bertani di sawah sebagai mata pencarian," ungkap Parir.detikcom pun kembali mengamati sekeliling Desa Parupay dengan lebih saksama. Amboi, sungguh menyejukkan mata dan tak bikin bosan! Hamparan lapangan hijau begitu luas sepanjang mata memandang.


Foto: (Pradita//detikcom)

Rumah-rumah yang juga di cat berwarna-warni menambah kesan cantik, serasa kita berada di belahan dunia mana. Padahal ini berada di kawasan hutan Kalimantan. Puluhan kerbau pun terlihat sehat dan dilepas begitu saja. Ahh ...ingin berlama-lama di suasana yang tenang seperti ini!Bagi wisatawan yang ingin datang ke Desa Parupay, dipersilahkan saja. Namun, jangan lupa lapor dahulu ke kepala desa."Di Parupay tidak ada penginapan, dan sesuai aturan pemerintah kita menyambut kedatangan turis di sini. Satu hal yang harus diperhatikan adalah jika ada tamu, lapor dulu ke kepala desa," jelasnya.


Foto: (Syanti Mustika/detikcom)

Desa Parupay berada di belakang Pos TNI di Long Midang. Untuk masuk dan sampai ke dalam desa kamu harus menggunakan kendaraan karena lokasinya lumayan jauh untuk jalan kaki. Selama perjalanan ke arah desa pun kami dimanjakan dnegan hamparan sawah dan perbukitan hijau.Kami ke sana pun setelah hujan dan jalanan sangat basah. Apalagi jalan ke arah desa bukanlah aspal, hanya jalan tanah biasa. Bisa bayangkan betapa terpacunya adrenalin kami melewati jalanan berlumpur tanah liat dengan puluhan lubang?Namun, tidak apa. Adrenalin kami terbayar dengan pemandangan desa yang indah menawan, sehingga menyisakan kenangan manis dan cerita tentang kecantikannya.Simak Video "Akhirnya, 74 Tahun Kegelapan Sirna Sudah"[Gambas:Video 20detik](sym/krs)

Stories from the Hidden Beauty Village in the Interior of Borneo
Nov 6, 2019, 21:19 by Syanti Mustika


Beautiful Parupay Village. (Syanti Mustika / detikcom)

Krayan - The interior of Kalimantan's forests is indeed full of surprises. One of them came from this village, whose beauty is so beautiful, despite its remote location in the middle of the jungle. The view is green, the sky is clean, the air is fresh and cool. At least those are the three things that can be enjoyed by Krayan, North Kalimantan. Guaranteed to linger to enjoy the tranquility of nature in the interior of Borneo. Some time ago the team of Tapal Batas detikcom came to Krayan. We "accidentally" came to a village called Desa Parupay.


Parupay Village in Krayan. (Photo: Syanti Mustika / detikcom)

Green plateau stretches very wide. The buffalos eat well in open fields. The houses are lined up neatly around the field there. And the village is surrounded by green hills. You could say this is a hidden village! On this occasion, detikcom also met with Pak Parir, Head of Parupay Village. He also kindly explained that they were preparing tourist destinations for tourists. "We have a tourist destination in nature there that we made two years ago. And this has been visited by tourists from West Kalimantan. We have historical heritage, there are two crocodile statues. "There is a stone hut, a stone and one grave. We also have two waterfalls as high as 50 meters and all of them are in our forest," said Parir.


Photo: (Syanti Mustika / detikcom)

But unfortunately, detikcom did not have the opportunity to visit the places in question because of its location in the forest and it takes a short time to be able to visit all the places. Parupay Village itself has 23 Family Cards with a total of 89 residents. And the main livelihood of this village is farming. "We all have 89 people, including young children. We are all here farming in the fields as livelihoods," said Parir. Amboi, soothing your eyes and not bored! Expanse of green field so wide as far as the eye could see.


Photo: (Pradita // detikcom)

Houses that are also painted in colorful colors add to the impression of beauty, as if we are in which part of the world. Though this is located in the Kalimantan forest area. Dozens of buffalo also look healthy and released. Ahh ... want to linger in a calm atmosphere like this! For tourists who want to come to the Village Parupay, just welcome. However, don't forget to report to the village head first. "In Parupay there are no lodgings, and according to government regulations we welcome tourists here. One thing to note is that if there are guests, report to the village head first," he explained.


Photo: (Syanti Mustika / detikcom)

Parupay Village is behind the TNI Post in Long Midang. To enter and get into the village you have to use a vehicle because the location is quite far to walk. During the trip to the village we were pampered with rice fields and green hills. We went there after the rain and the road was very wet. Moreover, the road to the village is not asphalt, just an ordinary dirt road. Can you imagine how adrenaline we are going through a muddy clay road with dozens of holes? Our adrenaline pays off with the beautiful views of the charming village, leaving sweet memories and stories about its beauty.
